alert.note: Alert for Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 17 at 6:42PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of , the southeastern City of Norfolk, the central City of Chesapeake, the southeastern City of Portsmouth and the northwestern City of Virginia Beach through 715 PM EDT... At 641 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Deep Creek, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Deep Creek and Chesapeake around 645 PM EDT. Cradock around 650 PM EDT. Great Bridge around 655 PM EDT. Regent University and Fentress around 700 PM EDT. Kempsville around 705 PM EDT. Virginia Beach around 715 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Greenbrier, South Norfolk, Portlock, Mount Pleasant, Princess Anne Plaza, Herberts Corner and Gallups Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
